topics.body:
I just realized something weird about myself: I literally have no morals whatsoever.


What I mean by this is that morals are based off axioms.  Essentially a person starts from the idea of say "I want to be good" (that's a axiom) and base their morals off that.

Me on the other hand my two axioms are the ideas of "strive to not physically harm others" and "the biological necessities in order to survive of multiple individuals are of higher importance than luxuries of a solitary individual", but beyond that I don't have any "morals" to speak of.  If someone were to go "Hit me!" I'd hit them with everything I got and I'd be lying if I said I didn't enjoy it.  I lie all the fucking time if it's for promoting a person's well being or such, cause in my mind if you're lying to help someone get their food at the end of the day then what's so "wrong" about that?  I'll admit that I've straight up stolen, not anything really valuable just like clothes or blankets or cans of food that nobody wants from people's clothes closets that they never wear (what's minus one tshirt out of a hundred from a hoarder's closet?), for someone that needed it from someone that wouldn't miss it and would just write it off as having lost it.  I've only ever stolen like $3 combined in my life for myself, but that was just for like soda or such; on the other hand "hey uc9; have you seen my tshirt?"  "Nope *hands said tshirt to someone that lost their house during a tornado or such"

Side note: 0 possessions I own are stolen and nothing I own was bought by someone else even as a gift or such.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
